conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the forces acting on block A in both scenarios and determine the friction force when the angle is changed to 30°.
Block A is placed on an inclined plane with an inclination of 37° in Figure A.
Block A is placed on an inclined plane with an inclination of 30° and a smooth cylinder B is between A and the inclined plane in Figure B.
Forces on Block A include gravitational force (Mg), normal force (N), and friction force (f).

premise: Block A is at rest on the incline at 37°.
conclusion: The forces along the incline must balance.

premise: Component of gravitational force along the incline is Mg sin 37°.
conclusion: The friction force f must balance this component: f = Mg sin 37°.
Forces on Block A in Scenario 2 include gravitational force (Mg), normal force (N), friction force (f'), and force due to cylinder B (F_B).

premise: Block A is at rest on the incline at 30° with cylinder B.
conclusion: The forces along the incline must balance.

premise: Component of gravitational force along the incline is Mg sin 30°.
conclusion: The friction force f' must balance this component: f' = Mg sin 30°.

premise: The friction force of block A on the slope when the angle is 30° and a smooth cylinder B is placed between A and the inclined plane is 2mg.
conclusion: The friction force of A on the slope is 2mg.
